snippet: Considering that David Barron is being vetted for a lifetime post, senators have a right to see his memos that justified the use of drones to kill an American.
abstract: Editorial notes controversy surrounding Pres Obama's appointment of lawyer David Barron to be judge on United States Court of Appeals for the first Circuit; points out Barron was supporter of use of drones to kill militant Anwar al-Awlaki in Yemen in 2011; holds Congress has a right to see his memos that justified the use of drones to kill an American, but so do American citizens; urges public release of memos before Barron is approved.
lead_paragraph: Considering that David Barron is being vetted for a lifetime post, senators have a right to see his memos that justified the use of drones to kill an American.

headline.main: The Lawyer Behind the Drone Policy
